title: Identify the relevant data points
text: To find the fraction of people who commute either five or seven miles, first identify how many people commute exactly five miles and how many commute exactly seven miles.

title: Count the number of people commuting five miles
text: Look at the data set and count how many people commute exactly five miles.

title: Count the number of people commuting seven miles
text: Now, count how many people commute exactly seven miles.

title: Calculate the total number of people commuting five or seven miles
text: Add the number of people commuting five miles to the number of people commuting seven miles.

title: Determine the fraction
text: Divide the total number of people commuting five or seven miles by the total number of people surveyed.
